org.wikipedia.miner.util.morphology
Class Normalizer

java.lang.Object
  org.wikipedia.miner.util.morphology.MorphologicalProcessor
      org.wikipedia.miner.util.morphology.Normalizer

public class Normalizer
extends MorphologicalProcessor

This class provides very agressive morphology. This involves cleaning the text using a TextCleaner, removing all stopwords, stemming individual terms using porter's stemmer, and ordering the remaining terms alphabetically.

Constructor Detail

Normalizer

public Normalizer(java.io.File stopwordFile)
           throws java.io.IOException
Initializes a newly created Normalizer with a list of stopwords contained within the given file. The file must be in a format where each word is found on its own line.

Parameters:
stopwordFile - the file of stopwords
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is a problem reading from the file of stopwords

Normalizer

public Normalizer(java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> stopwords)
Initializes a newly created Normalizer with a HashSet of stopwords.

Parameters:
stopwords - the HashSet of stopwords
Method Detail

processText

public java.lang.String processText(java.lang.String text)
Returns the normalized version of the argument string. This involves cleaning the text using a TextCleaner, removing all stopwords, stemming individual terms using porter's stemmer, and ordering the remaining terms alphabetically.

Specified by:
processText in class MorphologicalProcessor
Parameters:
text - the string to be normalized
Returns:
the normalized string
